comments.author: philipp@weitershausen.de
comments.text:
Some questions:

* Is s.m.c the home of Sync? If so, we need to move the mozilla.com/sync content there. If not, then why does it mention Firefox Sync as much as it does? Or why does it even exist at all?

* Is/Will s.m.c be home to more services? If so, it should probably not mention Firefox Sync in the title.

* It looks like I made it (that's not a good thing to say for a web page). Why does it look different from any other mozilla.com website?
comments.creator: philipp@weitershausen.de
comments.raw_text:
Some questions:

* Is s.m.c the home of Sync? If so, we need to move the mozilla.com/sync content there. If not, then why does it mention Firefox Sync as much as it does? Or why does it even exist at all?

* Is/Will s.m.c be home to more services? If so, it should probably not mention Firefox Sync in the title.

* It looks like I made it (that's not a good thing to say for a web page). Why does it look different from any other mozilla.com website?

(In reply to comment #0)
> * Is s.m.c the home of Sync? If so, we need to move the mozilla.com/sync
> content there. If not, then why does it mention Firefox Sync as much as it
> does? Or why does it even exist at all?

Sync was the only service at the time.  It exists because we wanted to have a place to have services-specific docs/branding/etc.  It was also where the early account management tools (reset pw, delete account) lived, and we didn't want that stuff on the main site.

> * Is/Will s.m.c be home to more services? If so, it should probably not
> mention Firefox Sync in the title.

Yes, and there is a plan to change this to Mozilla Services at some point.  Has been blocked on figuring out new logo guidelines.

> * It looks like I made it (that's not a good thing to say for a web page).
> Why does it look different from any other mozilla.com website?

Martell made it.  It was designed a year ago, and hasn't been updated to the new look and feel.

Also: one bug per issue, yeesh.
